Waypoints.Name: slide 20
Waypoints.Description:
Merkel cell carcinoma with densely packed basophilic tumor cells beneath the epidermis (red/green edge)

Sparse macrophage (yellow) and dendritic (green) cells scattered throughout the tumor, with a higher density of T cells (white) and monocytes (magenta) at the periphery

Waypoints.Name: slide 21
Waypoints.Description:
Cells in the epidermis express both cytoplasmic Pan-CK (red) and membranous CD141 (green)
Immune cells located in the dermis adjacent to the tumor: T cells (white); macrophages (yellow); dendritic cells (green); and monocytes (magenta)
Basophilic tumor cells (B) express CK with a perinuclear dot-like pattern

Waypoints.Name: slide 22
Waypoints.Description: Cluster of immune cells, consisting T cells (white), macrophages (red), dendritic cells (green), monocytes (magenta) and B cells (blue)

Waypoints.Name: slide 23
Waypoints.Description:
T cell subsets:
CTL: CD8+CD4- (blue)
T helper cells: CD4+CD8- (green)
Exhausted CTL: CD8+PD-1+ (magenta)
Exhausted T helper: CD4+PD-1+ (yellow)

Waypoints.Name: slide 24
Waypoints.Description:
Cells in the epidermis express higher levels of CD138 (green) and Pan-CK (white) compared to the basophilic tumor cells

there is no inset in minerva
CD138 is also expressed in the stroma, blood vessels and dendritic cells (inset)

HLA-ABC (red) is observed on the immune and epithelial cells, however, tumor cells have little to no expression
